raw_answer:
The document provides the following general comments about the data for patient 'AII-11' from 'Family A':

*   One disease allele was detected by analyzing patient AII-11 and his relatives. (Page 3)
*   The chromosomal phase was determined for patient AII-11 (family A). (Page 4)
*   Patient AII-11 was a 77-year-old man who developed right upper limb rest tremor at age 62. At age 75, he underwent gastrostomy for progressive dysphagia, then developed cognitive dysfunction without hallucination. Single-photon emission computed tomography of cerebral blood flow showed no reduction in blood flow in the basal ganglia. (Page 3)
*   MIBG scintigraphy was performed when AII-11 was 76 years old. (Page 3, Table 2 footnote)
*   The discussion notes that dementia may occur in patients with a long disease course, similar to patient AII-11, who had PD for 15 years. (Page 4)
question: Format answer for: Regarding patient 'AII-11' from family 'Family A': Any additional general comments about this data?
context:
The document provides the following general comments about the data for patient 'AII-11' from 'Family A':

*   One disease allele was detected by analyzing patient AII-11 and his relatives. (Page 3)
*   The chromosomal phase was determined for patient AII-11 (family A). (Page 4)
*   Patient AII-11 was a 77-year-old man who developed right upper limb rest tremor at age 62. At age 75, he underwent gastrostomy for progressive dysphagia, then developed cognitive dysfunction without hallucination. Single-photon emission computed tomography of cerebral blood flow showed no reduction in blood flow in the basal ganglia. (Page 3)
*   MIBG scintigraphy was performed when AII-11 was 76 years old. (Page 3, Table 2 footnote)
*   The discussion notes that dementia may occur in patients with a long disease course, similar to patient AII-11, who had PD for 15 years. (Page 4)
